attributes.action: Increase pedestrian crossing times to enable disabled people to cross safely
attributes.background:
Often when I wait to cross the road and the green man appears, it goes off again whilst I'm only halfway through crossing - and I'm an able bodied person.

My father has MS and walks with a stick, meaning he and many other disabled people are not provided with enough time to safely cross the road.

attributes.action: To be able to get a vehicle privately removed if it is deemed an obstruction
attributes.background: The laws on obstruction of someone's property is limited! If a vehicle is obstructing entrance to your property, be it drive way/carport or land, make it possible for you to get it privately towed without having to get the police involved!

attributes.action: Reinstate the funding for the Underground Maths project.
attributes.background: The Underground Maths website was the best resource available for teachers of A level Maths. The DfE recently stopped its funding. The removal of the funding means that it will no longer be developed, and it has been left incomplete. A level mathematics teaching in the UK will be poorer for it.
attributes.additional_details:
For more information, see these links. The Smith report is a government report on mathematics teaching that specifically endorses the Underground Maths project.

https://undergroundmathematics.org/ 

https://www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/exclusive-dfe-abandons-flagship-maths-programme

https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/smith-review-of-post-16-maths-report-and-government-response

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of time from 5 years to 3 for a divorce without consent.
attributes.background: You can divorce with their consent after 2 years separation but if they decide not to consent you then have to wait 5 years and you can divorce without their consent. 5 years is too long and more than double the 2 years with consent.

attributes.action: Require that sheltered accommodation residents are checked daily
attributes.background: A very close friend was lying unconscious while she lived in sheltered accommodation. She was not checked on which means many elderly people are being left unconscious which may then result in death.
attributes.additional_details: My friend is still in intensive care.

attributes.action: Make online markets such as eBay responsible for issuing a full Vat invoice.
attributes.background: Rarely are proper invoices sent out with purchases made on line, it should be the responsibility of the online market to issue a full invoice with sellers details at time of purchase and it should clearly show before final payment if Vat is being charged

attributes.action: Make local councils install CCTV outside schools to reduce the risk of accidents
attributes.background:
We all see lazy parents dropping their children off at school. 

This petition is to ask the government to make it compulsory for local councils to install cctv outside schools to catch and fine drivers who ignore road safety. In an attempt to persuade lazy drivers not to park on zig zag markings.

attributes.action: Add red hair colour to the protected characteristics of the Equality Act.
attributes.background: Stop cruel comments with insinuations that being a red head is unfortunate ugly and embarrassing.That a person deserves to be bullied because there a red head.
attributes.additional_details: Taunting red heads seems to be the last socially accepted freebie in society, yet it's impact can be as devastating to the receiver as any person covered in the discrimination act. Abuse ranges from name calling which leads to low self esteem and depression. Most disturbing suicide. Serious assaults have occurred just for being a red head. A red head can't change the colour of hair. Like a person can't change their skin colour, sexual orientation or disability.  It can't continue. It's not "OK".

attributes.action: Make the Treasury remove the VAT on fuel duty
attributes.background: If you buy fuel at £1.229 per litre, petrol or diesel, are you aware that 11.59 pence of the total VAT on the fuel you purchase is actually a tax upon the fuel duty, which is also a government tax on fuel!!!
attributes.additional_details: If the VAT on the fuel duty is removed, then the £1.229p cost of fuel will reduce to £1.02p!!!!

attributes.action: Reverse the government plans to remove women's refuges from the welfare system.
attributes.background: Katie Ghose, the chief executive of Women’s Aid, said: “The government’s proposed reforms to supported housing will dismantle our national network of lifesaving refuges and put the lives of women and children trying to escape domestic abuse at risk. This is a matter of life or death.”
attributes.additional_details:
Katie Ghose, the chief executive of Women’s Aid told the Guardian

 “If pursued, the reforms will result in a postcode lottery of domestic abuse support services, with ... refuges being forced to close their doors and more women and children being turned away from the lifesaving support they offer,” she said.

The reforms fly in the face of pledges made by the prime minister to make it a key personal priority to transform the way the UK tackles domestic violence.

attributes.action: Change the law, so that UK citizens can force an immediate General Election.
attributes.background: At present a vote of no confidence can only be called by parliament, leaving majority governments in an almost untouchable position. This means that governments can break promises at any time.
attributes.additional_details: Citizens should be able to hold the government to account at all times, not just during General Elections. The law needs to be changed so that a petition of 'no confidence' to parliament, containing the signatures of at least 51% of the population means a General Election is immediately called.

attributes.action: Save Old Heath Saxon Church, Chesterfield, Derbyshire.
attributes.background: Old Heath Saxon Church mentioned in the Doomsday Book is going to be demolished for HS2 ROUTE. Save our Saxon history, we wouldn't knock down Stonehenge or other historic structures. Please don't let this happen.
attributes.additional_details: HS2 proposed route

attributes.action: Clothing shops to have full disabled access and disabled changing facilities
attributes.background: Many stores in the UK don’t have disabiled access and unsutiable changing facilities for people with disabilities. I would like the government to introduce legislation that would make it compulsory for all clothing stores to have disabled changing facilities.

attributes.action: Prevent purchasers withdrawing from domestic property sales without consequence.
attributes.background: In England purchasers having had an offer accepted by the vendor are at liberty to withdraw from the transaction right up until contracts are exchanged without any cause. When this happens the vendors are usually unable to complete their purchase and left with significant nugatory costs to bear.

attributes.action: Ban farm machinery using the A55 during peak commuting hours
attributes.background: Slow-moving farm machinery is often causing delays during peak times for commuters. This has also often led to accidents causing lane/road closures and further/longer delays, as well as a drain on resources and a increased carbon emissions.

attributes.action: Post study work visa should be introduced again for tier4 international students
attributes.background: Post study work visa was valid till 2012. Now winning a lottery might be an easy task for an international student  ( that too is not a good example because of no public funds clause) but getting a job with tier 2 specifications is a nightmare for the students who arrive here on loans and much more.

attributes.action: Condemn the military action against ethnic Kurds by Iran and Iraq.
attributes.background: After the decision by the people of Kurdistan for independence in a referendum, retaliatory force by the Iranian backed militia and the Iraqi army against Kurdish populations in Kirkuk have resulted in dispossession and ethnically motivated crime.

attributes.action: Require all pubs and clubs to have metal detectors
attributes.background: By making it a legal requirement to have metal detectors at the entrances of pubs and clubs we could prevent people from even carrying a knife on a night out; fear of it being found and leading to a criminal offence of carrying a deadly weapon.
attributes.additional_details: The security staff on pubs and clubs are there to protect customers and adhere to rules and policies of the venue –how can they protect someone from a knife if they are unaware of someone entering with a weapon of such.

attributes.action: Give Retained Firefighters the right to leave employment to respond to 999 calls
attributes.background: Retained Firefighters make up a majority of the fire stations across Norfolk. Retained FireFighters drop their responsibilities the second their alerters alarm. Heading towards the fire station to respond to a 999 emergency.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm appealing for the rights of these firemen to be able to leave their employment to respond to life changing 999 calls . 

I aim to make it a law that employers have to allow retained Firefighters to leave their workplace to respond to these fire calls .

attributes.action: Increase the budget for crime and justice and hire more police to reduce crime
attributes.background:
Due to aggressive funding cuts and large decreases in the number of police officers during the coalition and Conservative governments, the crime rate has been rapidly increasing.

A lower budget means police cannot respond effectively to all threats due to a lack of resources such as riot gear.
attributes.additional_details:
Since 2010, the number of police officers has decreased by almost 20,000, and Authorised Firearms Officers by 1,337, according to official statistics, alongside aggressive funding cuts of 18%. The number of police officers has decreased for eight years in a row.

This has caused a significant increase in crime recently, with the crime rate increasing by 10% in March 2016-17 and annual reports of violent crime doubling since 2012.

We need to increase the budget to stop this increase in crime.

attributes.action: Prescribe dance fitness classes on the NHS for everyone's good health
attributes.background: Classes like Zumba should be free and prescribed to everyone on the NHS as they provide multiple health benefits including losing weight and has been known to fight depression.

attributes.action: End homelessness in Britain by adopting and funding the "Housing First" project.
attributes.background: There are over 9000 homeless people living on the streets of Britain. Many are ex military men and women suffering from mental health issues. No one chooses to be homeless. Britain can and should eradicate homelessness. The "Housing First" model has already proven to reduce homelessness in Europe.
attributes.additional_details: Finland adopted the "Housing First" model in 2008. To date Finland is the only European country to see homelessness numbers falling. The model is simple: Provide a home first, treat the causes of homelessness and help people to retrain and get back into work and reintegrate into society. Not only is "Housing First" cost effective but it is morally the "right thing to do". Many MP's already support "Housing First". By supporting this petition you could force a parliamentary debate.

attributes.action: Introduce legislation to protect students from universities and letting agencies
attributes.background: Started by a student who has had exposure to injustice in regards to university, letting agencies and landlords. University is stressful as it is, let alone overpaying for a property that isn't fit for purpose. I want to make life bearable for students who want to better themselves.
attributes.additional_details:
It should be illegal for:

- Letting agencies and landlords to let below par properties for high rent.

- Universities who knowingly deliver below par education and still charge high fees.

- Letting agencies and landlords to overcharge student deposits.

One in four students suffer with mental health problems. Students are currently vulnerable and have no protection from the government against these flaws.  Students need to be taken seriously and be seen as the future of this country.

attributes.action: Impose a ban on unnessary plastic packaging being sold in supermarkets
attributes.background:
BP2 has highlighted how plastic is affecting our ecosystems with terrible consequences. 

Supermarkets are guilty of wrapping everything from avocado to apples in plastic which is rarely recyclable. 

Let’s demand that by law, less plastic packaging is used and what is HAS to be recyclable.
attributes.additional_details:
8 million tonnes of plastic is found in our oceans every year and marine life is paying the price.  

Plastic bags have been retrieved from the stomachs of multiple mammals including whales and albatross. Plastic forks have been found lodged in the noses of sea turtles and fish have been found growing around plastic pullrings and wrappers. 

It’s time the UK cleaned up its act and minimised our use of plastic before the damage is irreversible.

attributes.action: Withhold all contractual payments to the EU untill a Brexit deal is reached.
attributes.background:
If the UK thrives after Brexit, the EU is doomed.

I believe that's why the EU is making things difficult, but, we too can make things difficult by withholding the huge amounts of money we pay them until a Brexit deal is reached.

EU members are allowed to leave. Thier behaviour is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Abolish taxation on voluntary tips for good service.
attributes.background: A tip is a voluntary gift from a person being served to a server and as such should be given tax exempt status. As many people who rely on tips are students, in between jobs or in low income families this would help ease ever increasing money burdens and possibly even stimulate the economy.

attributes.action: Limit alcohol labels and add warnings
attributes.background: Make alcohol branding limited to standard labels and add warnings to the label of future effects and long term illnesses.

attributes.action: Continue the "Retained right of residence" for former Spouse of  EEA nationals
attributes.background:
Under Current EEA regulations, former spouses of EEA nationals, retain their right to reside in the UK, even after they cease to be family members of an EEA national.
.
attributes.additional_details: This is a vital protection, as this covers former spouses who have been the victims of domestic voilence and other vulnerable people. Furthermore, people who retain their right of residence, are living in the UK by the virtue of EEA law, and so it is only fair that these people are also covered by the brexit negotiations and the protections afforded to EEA nationals are also extended to those people who retain their right of residence

attributes.action: Requesting salary history to be made unlawful in the UK.
attributes.background:
Requesting salary history  as part of job selection process has to be made unlawful in the UK.This has been made a law in New York and other US states. So why not in the UK?

Being underpaid once shouldn't condemn you to a lifetime of inequality.
attributes.additional_details:
- A number of people are underpaid in the UK. Salary history should not be a factor in determining new pay as that undervalues the current market price for the position and skills of the employee.

- There is gender pay gap in the UK, and this will help bridge closing the gap. This is a well known issue in the UK which the government is tackling.

- Jobs will be offered based on skills, merit and demands of the job. Not gender, race or ethnicity.

attributes.action: Protect more of our countryside and seas by creating more conservation zones.
attributes.background: Disappearing habitat,destructive means of fishing by trawling, aquaculture in estuaries, pesticides in farming all harming our environment.

attributes.action: Set a limit on how much homework can be set. (Secondary school and below)
attributes.background:
Mental health problems in younger people is at the most it has ever been, a factor that contributes to this is Homework. Homework if used correctly CAN give benefits but if overused can have negative impacts.

Therefore I suggest a limit on homework to help tackle this issue.
attributes.additional_details:
What I suggest is that the amount of homework aloud to be set is limited per subject.

In a half term I believe per subject (Maths,Science, etc) there should be a limit on how much homework can be set that is mandatory to do. If a teacher wants to set more they can make the homework optional.
The limit I think would work is 5 or less pieces of mandatory homework per half term (Roughly 7 Weeks per half term) in every subject.

In France they have got rid of homework and it has worked well.

attributes.action: Give equal state pension to every state pensioner
attributes.background: Back in April 2016 the government introduced a new state pension of £155/week for state pensioners but if you were already a state pensioner i.e. pre April 2016 your state pension remained the same £125 per week surely this cannot be fair or just why should any state pensioner get £30 a week more.
attributes.additional_details: I am very vexed about this scenario if we were talking of a few pence but this is serious money approx. £30 per week or £120 per month I feel the government has created a two tier pension scheme one for rich state pensioners post April 2016 and one for poor state pensioners pre April 2016 I feel this is totally unfair as I am on the pre 2016 rate after having paid in over 38 years of national insurance contributions why should I receive less money per month than a "new pensioner".

attributes.action: The council  to provide 24/7 childcare service to enable anyone access to work.
attributes.background: I am a single parent trying to do evening classes and work, however I am finding it impossible to access registered childcare after 6pm or weekends.  I have spoken with the head teachers in schools and they also agree that they all have many parents who don't have support,  nurses, or shift-workers.
attributes.additional_details:
Childcare could be provided by the council 24/7 and staff located in any area.  This means people can work in extended jobs and is important in many sectors of work.  The private childcare arrangements is not supportive and last minute emergencies is unobtainable. 
If the council provided help with limit of children and let the establishment grow then it will provide more work to qualified childcare support and enable parents to work and not be discriminated against as currently they are.

attributes.action: Nurses to work without having to pay an annual registration £120 fee to the NMC
attributes.background: I'm asking the government to support nurses not having to pay an annual registration fee to the NMC which is very costly . Nurses should be able to register without having to pay any fees .

attributes.action: Be illegal to drive tractors on A roads between the hours of 8am to 7pm
attributes.background: Tractors and other slow moving farm vehicles are a menice to other road users due to them causing large tailbacks which make people take risks to over take.

attributes.action: Zero Rate all School Uniform for VAT regardless of size.
attributes.background: Children’s clothing is zero rated for VAT depending on size. But, larger school uniform is zero rated for children under 14 if it is unique to a school. No child can leave school before age 16, so this is unfair.  All customized school uniform, should be zero-rated, regardless of age.

attributes.action: Introduce a tourist tax in London - similar to the likes of New York and Naples.
attributes.background: Introducing a tourist tax would increase funds available in the capital for a whole range of issues - from tackling homelessness to improving existing infrastructure.

attributes.action: To stop lorries/buses overtaking on A roads and Motorways to reduce congestion.
attributes.background: The main problem on motorways is congestions and crashes. The problem is lorries are trying to overtake each other which takes too long which means the flow of traffic slows and causes congestion and crashes. It would stop the middle lane slowing which makes more cars stay in the middle lane.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/speed-limits

Above are the speed limits of vehicles over 7.5 tonnes to 60 mph which is 10 mph slower than the motorway speed.

attributes.action: Restrict the public sale of fireworks to silent firework types
attributes.background: When it comes to Guy Fawkes night and New Years Eve the disturbance created by the sale of fireworks is extreme. The general public should only be able to purchase "silent fireworks" to limit the inconvenience they cause. Pets and people of nervous disposition experience terror during this time.
attributes.additional_details: My pet dog absolutely hates the time of year when Fireworks are let off, the sale of explosive fireworks should be banned and replaced with "silent fireworks" which are available on the Continent. This would allow people to enjoy the firework displays without disturbance to animals and people with young children. Restrict the sale of industrial strength explosive fireworks to licenced displays only

attributes.action: Philip Hammond to withdraw comments on disabled workforce lowering productivity
attributes.background: On the 6.12.17 the chancellor said to MPs at the Treasury Select Committee: "It is almost certainly the case that by increasing participation in the workforce for example of disabled people[...]may have had an impact on overall productivity measurements."
attributes.additional_details:
Rather than scapegoating disabled people through unfounded simplistic claims around a pretty complex matter Mr Hammond would benefit from reading this DWP commissioned report:

https://www.google.co.uk/url?sa=t&source=web&rct=j&url=http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/20130314010347/http:/research.dwp.gov.uk/asd/asd5/rports2005-2006/rrep400.pdf&ved=0ahUKEwj-yP3UlYrYAhVI4KQKHd_mBpc4ChAWCCowAg&usg=AOvVaw3_mgkcqqS4_rwRlzoHoH3N

attributes.action: Make Alzheimer’s/Dementia care completely funded by the NHS.
attributes.background:
Full funding for the care of Alzheimer’s and Dementia patients should be covered by the NHS. Plenty of families face so many worries when a loved one goes into care and paying for their care shouldn’t be one of them. 
Please take a moment to sign my petition.
Thank you.

attributes.action: Ban Hate Groups, Britain First & English Defence League!
attributes.background: Under the Terrorism Act 2000, the Home Secretary may proscribe(ban) an organisation if (s)he believes it is concerned in terrorism, and it is proportionate to do. We call upon the Home Secretary to add Britain First and the EDL to the list of proscribed organisations.
attributes.additional_details:
This same terrorism act declares "acts of terrorism" as "acts of persons acting on behalf of, or in connection with, any organisation which carries out activities directed towards the overthrowing or influencing, by force or violence, of Her Majesty's government in the United Kingdom or any other government de jure or de facto."
We believe Britain First are advocates of racially motivated violence and this is well documented with violence at rallies and unfettered hate speech.
Britain does not tolerate this when it is religiously motivated, why should we tolerate it when it is founded on 'Nationalism'.

attributes.action: Ban all plastic shopping bags and instead only sell reusable shopping bags.
attributes.background: The impact of plastic bags on the environment is enormous. ... Approximately 100,000 sea turtles and other marine animals die every year because they either mistake the bags for food or get strangled in them, says Natural.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2017/nov/03/dramatic-rise-in-plastic-seabed-litter-around-uk
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/greenerideal.com/news/environment/0613-how-do-plastic-bags-affect-our-environment/amp/

attributes.action: The undersigned ask for the following to b implemented to End the Housing Crisis
attributes.background: We are in a Housing Crisis and something desperately needs to be done , such as these initiatives below;
attributes.additional_details:
GIVE Bursaries/reduce restrictions on Brownfield sites, especially to smaller housing companies;This will allow for more building, with the added benefit of being more sustainable.

THAT each development Must have a specified % of Council, Affordable, Single-living & Various bedroom houses avaliable, so to meet the needs of all the community. 

A LAW that after a developer has received planning permission, they have a specified amount of time in which to finish their build, to stop Land Banking.

attributes.action: Ban log burning stoves that pollute the air
attributes.background: Myself and my disabled husband cannot use our garden nor go out our door without smoke and smell on our clothes and air. Smoke and smell come into the house if we open a window or door.
attributes.additional_details: Have reported this to fire services, who saw it and gave us masks to wear to get to church. Carers have witnessed the debris and smoke. Environmental health officer saw it and debris and did nothing but said he should have collected the debris.

attributes.action: Spend at least 60 billion pounds every year in Defense by 2020
attributes.background: We, as well as British and US military officials, ask that the UK government increases the armed forces defense budget so we are able to protect our country from states such as Russia and North Korea. We must stop cuts to our armed forces at this critical time, to counter the threats that face today
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-41903960

attributes.action: Conjugal Visits Allowed In The UK To Stop Reoffending.
attributes.background: In the summer of 2014, The Howard League released a report entitled Sex in Prison. It explored the possibility of conjugal visits – which are not permitted in the UK but operate successfully in much of Europe, Canada and even the Middle East. Dr Atkinson was one of the researchers behind the paper.
attributes.additional_details: The Howard League released a report where it explored the possibility of conjugal visits – which are not permitted in the UK but operate successfully in much of Europe. Lorraine Atkinson was one of the researchers behind the paper who visited Halden prison in Norway in 2014, where conjugal visits are allowed. As a result, Norway has one of the lowest reoffending rates in the world, currently standing at 20%. In comparison, 59% of British prisoners reoffend within a year of being released.

attributes.action: Make rail strikes illegal
attributes.background: Rail strikes cause misery to millions of commuters and also have a negative impact on the economy. Taxpayers subsidise train delays too. Make train strikes illegal. Railway employees should be open to the modernisation of the railways which ultimately benefits all.

attributes.action: Start teaching a language thoroughly from the school year of reception (age 4/5)
attributes.background: Teaching a language from primary school level is not yet compulsory at key stage 1, which is a major part of a child’s development. If taught thoroughly from a younger age, the more likely a child is to remember the language, which will also help in their working future.
attributes.additional_details: A DfE representative found that there is no requirement to teach languages in all years in KS2, as long as the content of the programme of study has been covered by the end of KS2. The UK needs a multilingual population in order to succeed in a globalised world, for global citizenship, security and to operate efficiently in trade and investment. The research, commissioned by the British Council, also revealed that UK schoolchildren are now less likely to speak a foreign language than those in any other European nation.

attributes.action: Form a cross-party commission (national consensus) which negotiates Brexit
attributes.background:
I  think that the issue is too important, so we have to get it right. Such a Independent cross-party, all encapsulating approach will be formidable.
1. It will represent all of us 
2. it will show at the negotiations that; we mean Business! 
3. The whole nation will be behind it
attributes.additional_details:
When we and future generations look back at these historic times we can then at least know for sure that everyone took part and was represented in this monumental decision and effort of exiting the EU. And did it as seamlessly as possible.    

If we do not negotiate with national consensus the chances of us and the future generations resenting the actions that were taken will be inevitable.

eg. the IRAQ WAR and the Chilcott report
